That  
x

x
day  
x

x
the  
x

x
camp  
x

x
was  
x

x
moved  
x

x
  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
east  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
river,  
x

x
right  
x

x
between  
x

x
the  
x

x
arms  
x

x
  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain. 
x

x
The  
x

x
rocks  
x

x
echoed  
x

x
then  
x

x
with  
x

x
  
x

x
voices  
x

x
and  
x

x
with  
x

x
song,  
x

x
as  
x

x
they  
x

x
had  
x

x
not  
x

x
done  
x

x
for  
x

x
  
x

x
many  
x

x
a  
x

x
day. 
x

x
There  
x

x
was  
x

x
the  
x

x
sound,  
x

x
too,  
x

x
of  
x

x
elven-  
x

x
  
x

x
harps  
x

x
and  
x

x
of  
x

x
sweet  
x

x
music;  
x

x
and  
x

x
as  
x

x
it  
x

x
echoed  
x

x
up  
x

x
  
x

x
towards  
x

x
them  
x

x
it  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
chill  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
air  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
warmed,  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
caught  
x

x
faintly  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
fragrance  
x

x
of  
x

x
woodland  
x

x
flowers  
x

x
blossoming  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
spring. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
longed  
x

x
to  
x

x
escape  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
dark  
x

x
  
x

x
fortress  
x

x
and  
x

x
to  
x

x
go  
x

x
down  
x

x
and  
x

x
join  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
mirth  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
feasting  
x

x
by  
x

x
the  
x

x
fires. 
x

x
Some  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
younger  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
were  
x

x
moved  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
hearts,  
x

x
too,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
they  
x

x
muttered  
x

x
that  
x

x
they  
x

x
wished  
x

x
things  
x

x
had  
x

x
fallen  
x

x
  
x

x
out  
x

x
otherwise  
x

x
and  
x

x
that  
x

x
they  
x

x
might  
x

x
welcome  
x

x
such  
x

x
  
x

x
folk  
x

x
as  
x

x
friends;  
x

x
but  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
scowled. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
themselves  
x

x
brought  
x

x
forth  
x

x
  
x

x
harps  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
regained  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
hoard,  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
made  
x

x
music  
x

x

x

x
soften  
x

x
his  
x

x

x

x
but  
x

x
their  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
was  
x

x
not  
x

x
as  
x

x
elvish  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
was  
x

x
much  
x

x
like  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
song  
x

x

x

x
had  
x

x
sung  
x

x
long  
x

x
before  
x

x
in  
x

x
Bilbo’s  
x

x
  
x

x
little  
x

x
hobbit-hole. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Under  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain  
x

x
dark  
x

x
and  
x

x
tall  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
King  
x

x
has  
x

x
come  
x

x
unto  
x

x
his  
x

x
hall!  
x

x
  
x

x
His  
x

x
foe  
x

x
is  
x

x
dead,  
x

x
the  
x

x
Worm  
x

x
of  
x

x
Dread,  
x

x
  
x

x
And  
x

x
ever  
x

x
so  
x

x
his  
x

x
foes  
x

x
shall  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
sword  
x

x
is  
x

x
sharp,  
x

x
the  
x

x
spear  
x

x
is  
x

x
long,  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
arrow  
x

x
swift,  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate  
x

x
is  
x

x
strong;  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
heart  
x

x
is  
x

x
bold  
x

x
that  
x

x
looks  
x

x
on  
x

x
gold;  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
dwarves  
x

x
no  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
dwarves  
x

x

x
yore  
x

x

x

x
mighty  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
mountain  
x

x
throne  
x

x
once  
x

x

x
is  
x

x

x
  
x

x
O!  
x

x
wandering  
x

x
folk,  
x

x
the  
x

x
summons  
x

x
heed!  
x

x
  
x

x
Come  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
across  
x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
sorrow  
x

x
and  
x

x
misery  
x

x
of  
x

x
his  
x

x
people. 
x

x
They  
x

x
  
x

x
aided  
x

x
you  
x

x
in  
x

x
your  
x

x
distress,  
x

x
and  
x

x
in  
x

x
recompense  
x

x
  
x

x
you  
x

x
have  
x

x
thus  
x

x
far  
x

x
brought  
x

x
ruin  
x

x
only,  
x

x
though  
x

x
  
x

x
doubtless  
x

x
undesigned.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Now  
x

x
these  
x

x
were  
x

x
fair  
x

x
words  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
if  
x

x
  
x

x
proudly  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
that  
x

x

x
would  
x

x
at  
x

x

x

x
admit  
x

x
what  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x
any  
x

x

x

x

x

x
remember  
x

x
that  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
all  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
upon

x

x
a

x

x

x

x

x

x

find  
x

x
fault  
x

x
with  
x

x
him;  
x

x
but  
x

x
indeed  
x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
old  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x

x
disapproved  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
whole  
x

x
turn  
x

x
of  
x

x

x

x

x
had  
x

x
by

x

x
more  
x

of  
x

x

x

x

x
inside

was  
x

x
  
x

x
not  
x

x
at  
x

x
all  
x

x
to  
x

x
his  
x

x
taste. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“The  
x

x

x

x

x
still  
x

x
stinks  
x

x
of  
x

x
dragon,”

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

to  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
stone  
x

of  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

not  
x

x
heard. 
x

x
Good  
x

x
  
x

x
night!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Puzzled  
x

x
but  
x

x
cheered,  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
hurried  
x

x
on. 
x

x
He  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
guided  
x

x
to  
x

x
a  
x

x
safe  
x

x
ford  
x

x
and  
x

x
set  
x

x
across  
x

x
dry,  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
then  
x

x
he  
x

x
said  
x

x
farewell  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
elves  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
climbed  
x

x
carefully  
x

x
back  
x

x
towards  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate. 
x

x
Great  
x

x
  
x

x
weariness  
x

x
began  
x

x
to  
x

x
come  
x

x
over  
x

x
him;  
x

x
but  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
well  
x

x
before  
x

x
midnight  
x

x
when  
x

x
he  
x

x
clambered  
x

x
up  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
rope  
x

x
again  
x

x
—  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x
still  
x

x
where  
x

x
he  
x

x
had  
x

x
left  
x

x
it. 
x

x
He  
x

x
  
x

x
untied  
x

x
it  
x

x
and  
x

x
hid  
x

x
it,  
x

x
and  
x

x
then  
x

x
he  
x

x
sat  
x

x
down  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wall  
x

x
and  
x

x
wondered  
x

x
anxiously  
x

x
what  
x

x
would  
x

x
  
x

x
happen  
x

x
next. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
At  
x

x
midnight  
x

x
he  
x

x
woke  
x

x
up  
x

x
Bombur;  
x

x
and  
x

x
then  
x

x
  
x

x
in  
x

x
turn  
x

x
rolled  
x

x
himself  
x

x
up  
x

x
in  
x

x
his  
x

x
corner,  
x

x
without  
x

x
  
x

x
listening  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
old  
x

x
dwarfs  
x

x
thanks  
x

x
(which  
x

x
he  
x

x
felt  
x

x
  
x

x
he  
x

x
had  
x

x
hardly  
x

x
earned). 
x

x
He  
x

x
was  
x

x
soon  
x

x
fast  
x

x
asleep  
x

x
  
x

x
forgetting  
x

x
all  
x

x
his  
x

x
worries  
x

x
till  
x

x
the  
x

x
morning. 
x

x
As  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
matter  
x

x
of  
x

x
fact  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
dreaming  
x

x
of  
x

x
eggs  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
bacon. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
 
x

x
Chapter  
x

x
XVII  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
THE  
x

x
CLOUDS  
x

x
BURST  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Next  
x

x
day  
x

x
the  
x

x
trumpets  
x

x
rang  
x

x
early  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
camp. 
x

x
  
x

x
Soon  
x

x
a  
x

x
single  
x

x
runner  
x

x
was  
x

x
seen  
x

x
hurrying  
x

x
along  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
narrow  
x

x
path. 
x

x
At  
x

x
a  
x

x
distance  
x

x
he  
x

x
stood  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
hailed  
x

x
them,  
x

x
asking  
x

x
whether  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
would  
x

x
now  
x

x
  
x

x
listen  
x

x
to  
x

x
another  
x

x
embassy,  
x

x
since  
x

x
new  
x

x
tidings  
x

x
  
x

x
had  
x

x
come  
x

x
to  
x

x
hand,  
x

x
and  
x

x
matters  
x

x
were  
x

x
changed. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“That  
x

x
will  
x

x
be  
x

x
Dain!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
when  
x

x
he  
x

x
  
x

x
heard. 
x

x
“They  
x

x
will  
x

x
have  
x

x
got  
x

x
wind  
x

x
of  
x

x
his  
x

x
coming. 
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
thought  
x

x
that  
x

x
would  
x

x
alter  
x

x
their  
x

x
mood!  
x

x
Bid  
x

x
them  
x

x
  
x

x
come  
x

x
few  
x

x
in  
x

x
number  
x

x
and  
x

x
weaponless,  
x

x
and  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
  
x

x
hear,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
called  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
messenger. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
About  
x

x
midday  
x

x
the  
x

x
banners  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Forest  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
Lake  
x

x
were  
x

x
seen  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
borne  
x

x
forth  
x

x
  
x

x
again. 
x

x
A  
x

x
company  
x

x
of  
x

x
twenty  
x

x
was  
x

x
approaching. 
x

x
  
x

x
At  
x

x
the  
x

x
beginning  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
narrow  
x

x
way  
x

x
they  
x

x
laid  
x

x
  
x

x
aside  
x

x
sword  
x

x
and  
x

x
spear,  
x

x
and  
x

x
came  
x

x
on  
x

x
towards  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate. 
x

x
Wondering,  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
saw  
x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x
among  
x

x
them  
x

x
were  
x

x
both  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
Elvenking,  
x

x
  
x

x
before  
x

x
whom  
x

x
an  
x

x
old  
x

x
man  
x

x
wrapped  
x

x
in  
x

x
cloak  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
hood  
x

x
bore  
x

x
a  
x

x
strong  
x

x
casket  
x

x
of  
x

x
iron-bound  
x

x
wood. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Hail  
x

x
Thorin!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Bard. 
x

x
“Are  
x

x
you  
x

x
still  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
same  
x

x
mind?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“My  
x

x
mind  
x

x
does  
x

x
not  
x

x
change  
x

x
with  
x

x
the  
x

x
rising  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
setting  
x

x
of  
x

x
a  
x

x
few  
x

x
suns,”  
x

x
answered  
x

x
Thorin. 
x

x
  
x

x
“Did  
x

x
you  
x

x
come  
x

x
to  
x

x
ask  
x

x
me  
x

x
idle  
x

x
questions?  
x

x
Still  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
elf-host  
x

x
has  
x

x
not  
x

x
departed  
x

x
as  
x

x
I  
x

x
bade!  
x

x
Till  
x

x
then  
x

x
  
x

x
you  
x

x
come  
x

x
in  
x

x
vain  
x

x
to  
x

x
bargain  
x

x
with  
x

x
me.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Is  
x

x
there  
x

x
then  
x

x
nothing  
x

x
for  
x

x
which  
x

x
you  
x

x
would  
x

x
  
x

x
yield  
x

x
any  
x

x
of  
x

x
your  
x

x
gold?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
"Nothing  
x

x
that  
x

x
you  
x

x
or  
x

x
your  
x

x
friends  
x

x
have  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
offer.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“What  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Arkenstone  
x

x
of  
x

x
Thrain?”  
x

x
said  
x

x
  
x

x
he,  
x

x
and  
x

x
at  
x

x
the  
x

x
same  
x

x
moment  
x

x
the  
x

x
old  
x

x
man  
x

x
  
x

x
opened  
x

x
the  
x

x
casket  
x

x
and  
x

x
held  
x

x
aloft  
x

x
the  
x

x
jewel. 
x

x
The  
x

x
  
x

x
light  
x

x
leapt  
x

x
from  
x

x
his  
x

x
hand,  
x

x
bright  
x

x
and  
x

x
white  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
morning. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
was  
x

x
stricken  
x

x
dumb  
x

x
with  
x

x
  
x

x
amazement  
x

x
and  
x

x
confusion. 
x

x
No  
x

x
one  
x

x
spoke  
x

x
for  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
long  
x

x
while. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
at  
x

x
length  
x

x
broke  
x

x
the  
x

x
silence,  
x

x
and  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
voice  
x

x
was  
x

x
thick  
x

x
with  
x

x
wrath. 
x

x
“That  
x

x
stone  
x

x
was  
x

x
my  
x

x
  
x

x
father’s,  
x

x
and  
x

x
is  
x

x
mine,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said. 
x

x
“Why  
x

x
should  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
purchase  
x

x
my  
x

x
own?”  
x

x
But  
x

x
wonder  
x

x
overcame  
x

x
him  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
added:  
x

x
“But  
x

x
how  
x

x
came  
x

x
you  
x

x
by  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
heirloom  
x

x
of  
x

x
my  
x

x
house  
x

x
—  
x

x
if  
x

x
there  
x

x
is  
x

x
need  
x

x
to  
x

x
ask  
x

x
  
x

x
such  
x

x
a  
x

x
question  
x

x
of  
x

x
thieves?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“We  
x

x
are  
x

x
not  
x

x
thieves,”  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
answered. 
x

x
“Your  
x

x
  
x

x
own  
x

x
we  
x

x
will  
x

x
give  
x

x
back  
x

x
in  
x

x
return  
x

x
for  
x

x
our  
x

x
own.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“How  
x

x
came  
x

x
you  
x

x
by  
x

x
it?”  
x

x
shouted  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
gathering  
x

x
rage. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“I  
x

x
gave  
x

x
it  
x

x
to  
x

x
them!”  
x

x
squeaked  
x

x
Bilbo,  
x

x
who  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
peering  
x

x
over  
x

x
the  
x

x
wall,  
x

x
by  
x

x
now  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x
dreadful  
x

x
  
x

x
fright. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“You!  
x

x
You!”  
x

x
cried  
x

x
Thorin,  
x

x
turning  
x

x
upon  
x

x
him  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
grasping  
x

x
him  
x

x
with  
x

x
both  
x

x
hands. 
x

x
“You  
x

x
  
x

x
miserable  
x

x
hobbit!  
x

x
You  
x

x
undersized  
x

x
—  
x

x
burglar!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
  
x

x
shouted  
x

x
at  
x

x
a  
x

x
loss  
x

x
for  
x

x
words,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
shook  
x

x
poor  
x

x
  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
like  
x

x
a  
x

x
rabbit. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“By  
x

x
the  
x

x
beard  
x

x
of  
x

x
Durin!  
x

x
I  
x

x
wish  
x

x
I  
x

x
had  
x

x
Gandalf  
x

x
  
x

x
here!  
x

x
Curse  
x

x
him  
x

x
for  
x

x
his  
x

x
choice  
x

x
of  
x

x
you!  
x

x
May  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
beard  
x

x
wither!  
x

x
As  
x

x
for  
x

x
you  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
throw  
x

x
you  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
rocks!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
cried  
x

x
and  
x

x
lifted  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
in  
x

x
his  
x

x
arms. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Stay!  
x

x
Your  
x

x
wish  
x

x
is  
x

x
granted!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
a  
x

x
voice. 
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
old  
x

x
man  
x

x
with  
x

x
the  
x

x
casket  
x

x
threw  
x

x
aside  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
hood  
x

x
and  
x

x
cloak. 
x

x
“Here  
x

x
is  
x

x
Gandalf!  
x

x
And  
x

x
none  
x

x
too  
x

x
  
x

x
soon  
x

x
it  
x

x
seems. 
x

x
If  
x

x
you  
x

x
don’t  
x

x
like  
x

x
my  
x

x
Burglar,  
x

x
  
x

x
please  
x

x
don’t  
x

x
damage  
x

x
him. 
x

x
Put  
x

x
him  
x

x
down,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
listen  
x

x
first  
x

x
to  
x

x
what  
x

x
he  
x

x
has  
x

x
to  
x

x
say!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“You  
x

x
all  
x

x
seem  
x

x
in  
x

x
league!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
  
x

x
dropping  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
top  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
wall. 
x

x
“Never  
x

x
  
x

x
again  
x

x
will  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
dealings  
x

x
with  
x

x
any  
x

x
wizard  
x

x
or  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
friends. 
x

x
What  
x

x
have  
x

x
you  
x

x
to  
x

x
say,  
x

x
you  
x

x
descendant  
x

x
  
x

x
of  
x

x
rats?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Dear  
x

x
me!  
x

x
Dear  
x

x
me!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Bilbo. 
x

x
“I  
x

x
am  
x

x
sure  
x

x
  
x

x
this  
x

x
is  
x

x
all  
x

x
very  
x

x
uncomfortable. 
x

x
You  
x

x
may  
x

x
  
x

x
remember  
x

x
saying  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
might  
x

x
choose  
x

x
my  
x

x
own  
x

x
  
x

x
fourteenth  
x

x
share?  
x

x
Perhaps  
x

x
I  
x

x
took  
x

x
it  
x

x
too  
x

x
literally  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
—  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
been  
x

x
told  
x

x
that  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
are  
x

x
sometimes  
x

x
  
x

x
politer  
x

x
in  
x

x
word  
x

x
than  
x

x
in  
x

x
deed. 
x

x
The  
x

x
time  
x

x
was,  
x

x
all  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
same,  
x

x
when  
x

x
you  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
to  
x

x
think  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
been  
x

x
of  
x

x
some  
x

x
service. 
x

x
Descendant  
x

x
of  
x

x
rats,  
x

x
  
x

x
indeed!  
x

x
Is  
x

x
this  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
service  
x

x
of  
x

x
you  
x

x
and  
x

x
your  
x

x
  
x

x
family  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
was  
x

x
promised,  
x

x
Thorin?  
x

x
Take  
x

x
it  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
have  
x

x
disposed  
x

x
of  
x

x
my  
x

x
share  
x

x
as  
x

x
I  
x

x
wished,  
x

x
and  
x

x
let  
x

x
  
x

x
it  
x

x
go  
x

x
at  
x

x
that!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“I  
x

x
will,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
grimly. 
x

x
“And  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
let  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
go  
x

x
at  
x

x
that  
x

x
—  
x

x
and  
x

x
may  
x

x
we  
x

x
never  
x

x
meet  
x

x
again!”  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
he  
x

x
turned  
x

x
and  
x

x
spoke  
x

x
over  
x

x
the  
x

x
wall. 
x

x
“I  
x

x
am  
x

x
  
x

x
betrayed,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said. 
x

x
“It  
x

x
was  
x

x
rightly  
x

x
guessed  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
could  
x

x
not  
x

x
forbear  
x

x
to  
x

x
redeem  
x

x
the  
x

x
Arkenstone,  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
of  
x

x
my  
x

x
house. 
x

x
For  
x

x
it  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
give  
x

x
one  
x

x
  
x

x
fourteenth  
x

x
share  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
hoard  
x

x
in  
x

x
silver  
x

x
and  
x

x
gold,  
x

x
  
x

x
setting  
x

x
aside  
x

x
the  
x

x
gems;  
x

x
but  
x

x
that  
x

x
shall  
x

x
be  
x

x
  
x

x
accounted  
x

x
the  
x

x
promised  
x

x
share  
x

x
of  
x

x
this  
x

x
traitor,  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
with  
x

x
that  
x

x
reward  
x

x
he  
x

x
shall  
x

x
depart,  
x

x
and  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
can  
x

x
divide  
x

x
it  
x

x
as  
x

x
you  
x

x
will. 
x

x
He  
x

x
will  
x

x
get  
x

x
little  
x

x
enough,  
x

x
  
x

x
I  
x

x
doubt  
x

x
not. 
x

x
Take  
x

x
him,  
x

x
if  
x

x
you  
x

x
wish  
x

x
him  
x

x
to  
x

x
live;  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
no  
x

x
friendship  
x

x
of  
x

x
mine  
x

x
goes  
x

x
with  
x

x
him. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Get  
x

x
down  
x

x
now  
x

x
to  
x

x
your  
x

x
friends!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
Bilbo,  
x

x
“or  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
throw  
x

x
you  
x

x
down.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“What  
x

x
about  
x

x
the  
x

x
gold  
x

x
and  
x

x
silver?”  
x

x
asked  
x

x
  
x

x
Bilbo. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“That  
x

x
shall  
x

x
follow  
x

x
after,  
x

x
as  
x

x
can  
x

x
be  
x

x
arranged,”  
x

x
  
x

x
said  
x

x
he. 
x

x
“Get  
x

x
down!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Until  
x

x
then  
x

x
we  
x

x
keep  
x

x
the  
x

x
stone,”  
x

x
cried  
x

x
Bard. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“You  
x

x
are  
x

x
not  
x

x
making  
x

x
a  
x

x
very  
x

x
splendid  
x

x
figure  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
as  
x

x
King  
x

x
under  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Gandalf. 
x

x
“But  
x

x
  
x

x
things  
x

x
may  
x

x
change  
x

x
yet.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“They  
x

x
may  
x

x
indeed,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Thorin. 
x

x
And  
x

x
  
x

x
already,  
x

x
so  
x

x
strong  
x

x
was  
x

x
the  
x

x
bewilderment  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
upon  
x

x
him,  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
pondering  
x

x
whether  
x

x
  
x

x
by  
x

x
the  
x

x
help  
x

x
of  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
he  
x

x
might  
x

x
not  
x

x
recapture  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Arkenstone  
x

x
and  
x

x
withhold  
x

x
the  
x

x
share  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
reward. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
And  
x

x
so  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
was  
x

x
swung  
x

x
down  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wall,  
x

x
and  
x

x
departed  
x

x
with  
x

x
nothing  
x

x
for  
x

x
all  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
trouble,  
x

x
except  
x

x
the  
x

x
armour  
x

x
which  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
given  
x

x
him  
x

x
already. 
x

x
More  
x

x
than  
x

x
one  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
hearts  
x

x
felt  
x

x
shame  
x

x
and  
x

x
pity  
x

x
at  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
going. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Farewell!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
cried  
x

x
to  
x

x
them. 
x

x
“We  
x

x
may  
x

x
meet  
x

x
  
x

x
again  
x

x
as  
x

x
friends.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Be  
x

x
off!”  
x

x
called  
x

x
Thorin. 
x

x
“You  
x

x
have  
x

x
mail  
x

x
upon  
x

x
  
x

x
you,  
x

x
which  
x

x
was  
x

x
made  
x

x
by  
x

x
my  
x

x
folk,  
x

x
and  
x

x
is  
x

x
too  
x

x
  
x

x
good  
x

x
for  
x

x
you. 
x

x
It  
x

x
cannot  
x

x
be  
x

x
pierced  
x

x
by  
x

x
arrows;  
x

x
  
x

x
but  
x

x
if  
x

x
you  
x

x
do  
x

x
not  
x

x
hasten,  
x

x
I  
x

x
will  
x

x
sting  
x

x
your  
x

x
  
x

x
miserable  
x

x
feet. 
x

x
So  
x

x
be  
x

x
swift!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
"Not  
x

x
so  
x

x

x

x
said  
x

x
Bard. 
x

x
“We  
x

x
will  
x

x
give  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
until  
x

x
tomorrow. 
x

x
At  
x

x
noon  
x

x
we  
x

x
will  
x

x
return,  
x

x
and  
x

x
see  
x

x
if  
x

x
  
x

x
you  
x

x
have  
x

x
brought  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
hoard  
x

x
the  
x

x
portion  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
is  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
set  
x

x
against  
x

x
the  
x

x
stone. 
x

x
If  
x

x
that  
x

x
is  
x

x
done  
x

x
  
x

x
without  
x

x

x

x
then  
x

x
we  
x

x
will  
x

x
depart,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
elf-  
x

x
  
x

x
host  
x

x
will  
x

x
go  
x

x
back  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
Forest. 
x

x
In  
x

x
the  
x

x
meanwhile  
x

x
  
x

x
farewell!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
With  
x

x
that  
x

x
they  
x

x
went  
x

x
back  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
camp;  
x

x
but  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
sent  
x

x
messengers  
x

x
by  
x

x
Roac  
x

x
telling  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
what  
x

x
had  
x

x
passed,  
x

x
and  
x

x
bidding  
x

x
him  
x

x
come  
x

x
with  
x

x
  
x

x
wary  
x

x
speed. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
That  
x

x
day  
x

x
passed  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
night. 
x

x
The  
x

x
next  
x

x
day  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wind  
x

x
shifted  
x

x
west,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
air  
x

x
was  
x

x
dark  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
gloomy. 
x

x
The  
x

x
morning  
x

x
was  
x

x
still  
x

x
early  
x

x
when  
x

x
a  
x

x
cry  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
heard  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
camp. 
x

x
Runners  
x

x
came  
x

x
in  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
report  
x

x
that  
x

x
a  
x

x
host  
x

x
of  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
had  
x

x
appeared  
x

x
  
x

x
round  
x

x
the  
x

x
eastern  
x

x
spur  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain  
x

x
and  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
now  
x

x
hastening  
x

x
to  
x

x
Dale. 
x

x
Dain  
x

x
had  
x

x
come. 
x

x
He  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
hurried  
x

x
on  
x

x
through  
x

x
the  
x

x
night,  
x

x
and  
x

x
so  
x

x
had  
x

x
come  
x

x
  
x

x
upon  
x

x
them  
x

x
sooner  
x

x
than  
x

x
they  
x

x
had  
x

x
expected. 
x

x
  
x

x
Each  
x

x
one  
x

x
of  
x

x
his  
x

x
folk  
x

x
was  
x

x
clad  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x
hauberk  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
steel  
x

x
mail  
x

x
that  
x

x
hung  
x

x
to  
x

x
his  
x

x
knees,  
x

x
and  
x

x
his  
x

x
legs  
x

x
  
x

x
were  
x

x
covered  
x

x
with  
x

x
hose  
x

x
of  
x

x
a  
x

x
fine  
x

x
and  
x

x
flexible  
x

x
  
x

x
metal  
x

x
mesh,  
x

x
the  
x

x
secret  
x

x
of  
x

x
whose  
x

x
making  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
possessed  
x

x
by  
x

x
Dain’s  
x

x
people. 
x

x
The  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
are  
x

x
  
x

x
exceedingly  
x

x
strong  
x

x
for  
x

x
their  
x

x
height,  
x

x
but  
x

x
most  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
these  
x

x
were  
x

x
strong  
x

x
even  
x

x
for  
x

x
dwarves. 
x

x
In  
x

x
battle  
x

x
  
x

x
they  
x

x
wielded  
x

x
heavy  
x

x
two-handed  
x

x
mattocks;  
x

x
but  
x

x
  
x

x
each  
x

x
of  
x

x
them  
x

x
had  
x

x
also  
x

x
a  
x

x
short  
x

x
broad  
x

x
sword  
x

x
at  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
side  
x

x
and  
x

x
a  
x

x
roundshield  
x

x
slung  
x

x
at  
x

x
his  
x

x
back. 
x

x
  
x

x
Their  
x

x
beards  
x

x
were  
x

x
forked  
x

x
and  
x

x
plaited  
x

x
and  
x

x
thrust  
x

x
  
x

x
into  
x

x
their  
x

x
belts. 
x

x
Their  
x

x
caps  
x

x
were  
x

x
of  
x

x
iron  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
were  
x

x
shod  
x

x
with  
x

x
iron,  
x

x
and  
x

x
their  
x

x
faces  
x

x
were  
x

x
grim. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Trumpets  
x

x
called  
x

x
men  
x

x
and  
x

x
elves  
x

x
to  
x

x
arms. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Before  
x

x
long  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
could  
x

x
be  
x

x
seen  
x

x
coming  
x

x
  
x

x
up  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley  
x

x
at  
x

x
a  
x

x
great  
x

x
pace. 
x

x
They  
x

x
halted  
x

x
  
x

x
between  
x

x
the  
x

x
river  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
eastern  
x

x
spur;  
x

x
but  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
few  
x

x
held  
x

x
on  
x

x
their  
x

x
way,  
x

x
and  
x

x
crossing  
x

x
the  
x

x
river  
x

x
  
x

x
drew  
x

x
near  
x

x
the  
x

x
camp;  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
they  
x

x
laid  
x

x
down  
x

x
  
x

x
their  
x

x
weapons  
x

x
and  
x

x
held  
x

x
up  
x

x
their  
x

x
hands  
x

x
in  
x

x
sign  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
peace. 
x

x
Bard  
x

x
went  
x

x
out  
x

x
to  
x

x
meet  
x

x
them,  
x

x
and  
x

x
with  
x

x
  
x

x
him  
x

x
went  
x

x
Bilbo. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“We  
x

x
are  
x

x
sent  
x

x
from  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
son  
x

x
of  
x

x
Nain,”  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
said  
x

x
when  
x

x
questioned. 
x

x
“We  
x

x
are  
x

x
hastening  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
our  
x

x
kinsmen  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain,  
x

x
since  
x

x
we  
x

x
learn  
x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
kingdom  
x

x
of  
x

x
old  
x

x
is  
x

x
renewed. 
x

x
But  
x

x
who  
x

x
are  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
that  
x

x
sit  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
plain  
x

x
as  
x

x
foes  
x

x
before  
x

x
defended  
x

x
  
x

x
walls?”  
x

x
This,  
x

x
of  
x

x
course,  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
polite  
x

x
and  
x

x
rather  
x

x
  
x

x
old-fashioned  
x

x
language  
x

x
of  
x

x
such  
x

x
occasions,  
x

x
  
x

x
meant  
x

x
simply:  
x

x
“You  
x

x
have  
x

x
no  
x

x
business  
x

x
here. 
x

x
We  
x

x
  
x

x
are  
x

x
going  
x

x
on,  
x

x
so  
x

x
make  
x

x
way  
x

x
or  
x

x
we  
x

x
shall  
x

x
fight  
x

x
  
x

x
you!”  
x

x
They  
x

x
meant  
x

x
to  
x

x
push  
x

x
on  
x

x
between  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Mountain  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
loop  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
river;  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
narrow  
x

x
land  
x

x
there  
x

x
did  
x

x
not  
x

x
seem  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
strongly  
x

x
  
x

x
guarded. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Bard,  
x

x
of  
x

x
course,  
x

x
refused  
x

x
to  
x

x
allow  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
to  
x

x
go  
x

x
straight  
x

x
on  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain. 
x

x
He  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
determined  
x

x
to  
x

x
wait  
x

x
until  
x

x
the  
x

x
gold  
x

x
and  
x

x
silver  
x

x
  
x

x
had  
x

x
been  
x

x
brought  
x

x
out  
x

x
in  
x

x
exchange  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Arkenstone;  
x

x
for  
x

x
he  
x

x
did  
x

x
not  
x

x
believe  
x

x
that  
x

x
this  
x

x
  
x

x
would  
x

x
be  
x

x
done,  
x

x
if  
x

x
once  
x

x
the  
x

x
fortress  
x

x
was  
x

x
manned  
x

x
  
x

x
with  
x

x
so  
x

x
large  
x

x
and  
x

x
warlike  
x

x
a  
x

x
company. 
x

x
They  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
brought  
x

x
with  
x

x
them  
x

x
a  
x

x
great  
x

x
store  
x

x
of  
x

x
supplies;  
x

x
for  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
can  
x

x
carry  
x

x
very  
x

x
heavy  
x

x
burdens,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
nearly  
x

x
all  
x

x
of  
x

x
Dain’s  
x

x
folk,  
x

x
in  
x

x
spite  
x

x
of  
x

x
their  
x

x
rapid  
x

x
  
x

x
march,  
x

x
bore  
x

x
huge  
x

x
packs  
x

x
on  
x

x
their  
x

x
backs  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
addition  
x

x
to  
x

x
their  
x

x
weapons. 
x

x
They  
x

x
would  
x

x
stand  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
siege  
x

x
for  
x

x
weeks,  
x

x
and  
x

x
by  
x

x
that  
x

x
time  
x

x
yet  
x

x
more  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
might  
x

x
come,  
x

x
and  
x

x
yet  
x

x
more,  
x

x
for  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
  
x

x
had  
x

x
many  
x

x
relatives. 
x

x
Also  
x

x
they  
x

x
would  
x

x
be  
x

x
able  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
reopen  
x

x
and  
x

x
guard  
x

x
some  
x

x
other  
x

x
gate,  
x

x
so  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
besiegers  
x

x
would  
x

x
have  
x

x
to  
x

x
encircle  
x

x
the  
x

x
whole  
x

x
  
x

x
mountain;  
x

x
and  
x

x
for  
x

x
that  
x

x
they  
x

x
had  
x

x
not  
x

x
sufficient  
x

x
  
x

x
numbers. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
These  
x

x
were,  
x

x
in  
x

x
fact,  
x

x
precisely  
x

x
their  
x

x
plans  
x

x
  
x

x
(for  
x

x
the  
x

x
raven-messengers  
x

x
had  
x

x
been  
x

x
busy  
x

x
  
x

x
between  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
and  
x

x
Dain);  
x

x
but  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
moment  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
way  
x

x
was  
x

x
barred,  
x

x
so  
x

x
after  
x

x
angry  
x

x
words  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarf-messengers  
x

x
retired  
x

x
muttering  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
  
x

x
beards. 
x

x
Bard  
x

x
then  
x

x
sent  
x

x
messengers  
x

x
at  
x

x
once  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate;  
x

x
but  
x

x
they  
x

x
found  
x

x
no  
x

x
gold  
x

x
or  
x

x
payment. 
x

x
  
x

x
Arrows  
x

x
came  
x

x
forth  
x

x
as  
x

x
soon  
x

x
as  
x

x
they  
x

x
were  
x

x
within  
x

x
  
x

x
shot,  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
hastened  
x

x
back  
x

x
in  
x

x

x

x
In  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
camp  
x

x
all  
x

x
was  
x

x
now  
x

x
astir,  
x

x
as  
x

x
if  
x

x
for  
x

x
battle;  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
of  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
were  
x

x
advancing  
x

x
along  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
eastern  
x

x
bank. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Fools!”  
x

x
laughed  
x

x
Bard,  
x

x
“to  
x

x
come  
x

x
thus  
x

x
  
x

x
beneath  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain’s  
x

x
arm!  
x

x
They  
x

x
do  
x

x
not  
x

x
  
x

x
understand  
x

x
war  
x

x
above  
x

x
ground,  
x

x
whatever  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
may  
x

x
know  
x

x
of  
x

x
battle  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
mines. 
x

x
There  
x

x
are  
x

x
  
x

x
many  
x

x
of  
x

x
our  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
spearmen  
x

x
now  
x

x
hidden  
x

x
  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
rocks  
x

x
upon  
x

x
their  
x

x
right  
x

x

x

x
Dwarf-mail  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
may  
x

x
be  
x

x
good,  
x

x
but  
x

x
they  
x

x
will  
x

x
soon  
x

x
be  
x

x
hard  
x

x
put  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
it. 
x

x
Let  
x

x
us  
x

x
set  
x

x
on  
x

x
them  
x

x
now  
x

x
from  
x

x
both  
x

x
sides,  
x

x
  
x

x
before  
x

x
they  
x

x
are  
x

x
fully  
x

x
rested!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
But  
x

x
the  
x

x
Elvenking  
x

x
said:  
x

x
“Long  
x

x
will  
x

x
I  
x

x
tarry,  
x

x
ere  
x

x
  
x

x
I  
x

x
begin  
x

x
this  
x

x
war  
x

x
for  
x

x
gold. 
x

x
The  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
cannot  
x

x
  
x

x
pass  
x

x
us,  
x

x
unless  
x

x
we  
x

x
will,  
x

x
or  
x

x
do  
x

x
anything  
x

x
that  
x

x
we  
x

x
  
x

x
cannot  
x

x
mark. 
x

x
Let  
x

x
us  
x

x
hope  
x

x
still  
x

x
for  
x

x
something  
x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x
will  
x

x
bring  
x

x
reconciliation. 
x

x
Our  
x

x
advantage  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
numbers  
x

x
will  
x

x
be  
x

x
enough,  
x

x
if  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
end  
x

x
it  
x

x
must  
x

x
  
x

x
come  
x

x
to  
x

x
unhappy  
x

x
blows.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
But  
x

x
he  
x

x
reckoned  
x

x
without  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves. 
x

x
The  
x

x
  
x

x
knowledge  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
Arkenstone  
x

x
was  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
hands  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
besiegers  
x

x
burned  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
thoughts;  
x

x
  
x

x
also  
x

x
they  
x

x
guessed  
x

x
the  
x

x
hesitation  
x

x
of  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
friends,  
x

x
and  
x

x
resolved  
x

x
to  
x

x
strike  
x

x
while  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
debated. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Suddenly  
x

x
without  
x

x
a  
x

x
signal  
x

x
they  
x

x
sprang  
x

x
  
x

x
silently  
x

x
forward  
x

x
to  
x

x
attack. 
x

x
Bows  
x

x
twanged  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
arrows  
x

x
whistled;  
x

x
battle  
x

x
was  
x

x
about  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
joined. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Still  
x

x
more  
x

x
suddenly  
x

x
a  
x

x
darkness  
x

x
came  
x

x
on  
x

x
  
x

x
with  
x

x
dreadful  
x

x
swiftness!  
x

x
A  
x

x
black  
x

x
cloud  
x

x
hurried  
x

x
  
x

x
over  
x

x
the  
x

x
sky. 
x

x
Winter  
x

x
thunder  
x

x
on  
x

x
a  
x

x
wild  
x

x
wind  
x

x
  
x

x
rolled  
x

x
roaring  
x

x
up  
x

x
and  
x

x
rumbled  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain,  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
lightning  
x

x
lit  
x

x
its  
x

x
peak. 
x

x
And  
x

x
beneath  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
thunder  
x

x
another  
x

x
blackness  
x

x
could  
x

x
be  
x

x
seen  
x

x
  
x

x
whirling  
x

x
forward;  
x

x
but  
x

x
it  
x

x
did  
x

x
not  
x

x
come  
x

x
with  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wind,  
x

x
it  
x

x
came  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
North,  
x

x
like  
x

x
a  
x

x
vast  
x

x
cloud  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
birds,  
x

x
so  
x

x
dense  
x

x
that  
x

x
no  
x

x
light  
x

x
could  
x

x
be  
x

x
seen  
x

x
  
x

x
between  
x

x
their  
x

x
wings. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Halt!”  
x

x
cried  
x

x
Gandalf,  
x

x
who  
x

x
appeared  
x

x
  
x

x
suddenly,  
x

x
and  
x

x
stood  
x

x
alone,  
x

x
with  
x

x

x

x
uplifted,  
x

x
  
x

x
between  
x

x
the  
x

x
advancing  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
ranks  
x

x
  
x

x
awaiting  
x

x
them. 
x

x
“Halt!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
called  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x
voice  
x

x
like  
x

x
  
x

x
thunder,  
x

x
and  
x

x
his  
x

x
staff  
x

x
blazed  
x

x
forth  
x

x
with  
x

x
a  
x

x
flash  
x

x
  
x

x
like  
x

x
the  
x

x
lightning. 
x

x
“Dread  
x

x
has  
x

x
come  
x

x
upon  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
all!  
x

x
Alas!  
x

x
it  
x

x
has  
x

x
come  
x

x
more  
x

x
swiftly  
x

x
than  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
guessed. 
x

x
The  
x

x
Goblins  
x

x
are  
x

x
upon  
x

x
you!  
x

x
Bolg-  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
North  
x

x
is  
x

x
coming,  
x

x
O  
x

x
Dain!  
x

x
whose  
x

x
father  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
slew  
x

x
in  
x

x
Moria. 
x

x
Behold!  
x

x
the  
x

x
bats  
x

x
are  
x

x
above  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
army  
x

x
like  
x

x
a  
x

x
sea  
x

x
of  
x

x
locusts. 
x

x
They  
x

x
ride  
x

x
upon  
x

x
  
x

x
wolves  
x

x
and  
x

x
Wargs  
x

x
are  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
train!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
confusion  
x

x
fell  
x

x
upon  
x

x
them  
x

x
  
x

x
all. 
x

x
Even  
x

x
as  
x

x
Gandalf  
x

x
had  
x

x
been  
x

x
speaking  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
darkness  
x

x
grew. 
x

x
The  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
halted  
x

x
and  
x

x
gazed  
x

x
  
x

x
at  
x

x
the  
x

x
sky. 
x

x
The  
x

x
elves  
x

x
cried  
x

x
out  
x

x
with  
x

x
many  
x

x
voices. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Come!”  
x

x
called  
x

x
Gandalf. 
x

x
“There  
x

x
is  
x

x
yet  
x

x
time  
x

x
  
x

x
for  
x

x
council. 
x

x
Let  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
son  
x

x
of  
x

x
Nain  
x

x
come  
x

x
swiftly  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
us!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
So  
x

x
began  
x

x
a  
x

x
battle  
x

x
that  
x

x
none  
x

x
had  
x

x
expected;  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
was  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
Five  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x

x

x

x

x
Upon  
x

x
one  
x

x

x

were  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Goblins  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
Wild  
x

x
Wolves,  
x

x
and  
x

x
upon  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
other  
x

x
were  
x

x
Elves  
x

x
and  
x

x
Men  
x

x
and  
x

x
Dwarves. 
x

x
This  
x

x
is  
x

x
  
x

x
how  
x

x
it  
x

x
fell  
x

x
out. 
x

x
Ever  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

had  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x
now  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
in  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
was  
x

x
a  
x

x

x
and  
x

x
an  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
Then  
x

x

x

x

x

x
and  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
thus

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
North  
x

x
hard  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

of  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
cannot  
x

x

x

x

but  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
that  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
Mountain;  
x

x

x

x
themselves

to  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
or  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Soon  
x

x

x

x

x
passed,  
x

x

x
away  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
South-East;  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x
above  
x

x
them  
x

x
shutting  
x

x
out  
x

x
the  
x

x
light  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“To  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain!”  
x

x
called  
x

x
Bard. 
x

x
“To  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Mountain!  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

black  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
Ere  
x

x

x

x

x

x

swirled  
x

x
round  
x

x
the  
x

x
spur’s  
x

x
end  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
their

x

and  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
goblin  
x

x
army  
x

x
had  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain,  
x

x
seeking  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
and  
x

x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Lake-men,  
x

x
for  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
could  
x

x
not  
x

x
  
x

x
restrain  
x

x
them;  
x

x
and  
x

x
out  
x

x
upon  
x

x
the  
x

x
other  
x

x
side  
x

x
came  
x

x
  
x

x
many  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
spearmen  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
elves. 
x

x
Once  
x

x
again  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
were  
x

x
stricken  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley;  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
were  
x

x
piled  
x

x
in  
x

x
heaps  
x

x
till  
x

x
Dale  
x

x
was  
x

x
dark  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
hideous  
x

x
with  
x

x
their  
x

x
corpses. 
x

x
The  
x

x
Wargs  
x

x
were  
x

x
  
x

x
scattered  
x

x
and  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
drove  
x

x
right  
x

x
against  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
bodyguard  
x

x
of  
x

x
Bolg. 
x

x
But  
x

x
he  
x

x
could  
x

x
not  
x

x
pierce  
x

x
their  
x

x
  
x

x
ranks. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Already  
x

x
behind  
x

x
him  
x

x
among  
x

x
the  
x

x
goblin  
x

x
dead  
x

x
  
x

x
lay  
x

x
many  
x

x
men  
x

x
and  
x

x
many  
x

x
dwarves,  
x

x
and  
x

x
many  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
fair  
x

x
elf  
x

x
that  
x

x
should  
x

x
have  
x

x
lived  
x

x
yet  
x

x
long  
x

x
ages  
x

x
  
x

x
merrily  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
wood. 
x

x
And  
x

x
as  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley  
x

x
widened  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
onset  
x

x
grew  
x

x
ever  
x

x
slower. 
x

x
His  
x

x
numbers  
x

x
were  
x

x
  
x

x
too  
x

x
few. 
x

x
His  
x

x
flanks  
x

x
were  
x

x
unguarded. 
x

x
Soon  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
attackers  
x

x
were  
x

x
attacked,  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
were  
x

x
forced  
x

x
  
x

x
into  
x

x
a  
x

x
great  
x

x
ring,  
x

x
facing  
x

x
every  
x

x
way,  
x

x
hemmed  
x

x
all  
x

x
  
x

x
about  
x

x
with  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
and  
x

x
wolves  
x

x
returning  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
assault. 
x

x
The  
x

x
bodyguard  
x

x
of  
x

x
Bolg  
x

x
came  
x

x
howling  
x

x
  
x

x
against  
x

x
them,  
x

x
and  
x

x
drove  
x

x
in  
x

x
upon  
x

x
their  
x

x

x

x
like  
x

x
  
x

x
waves  
x

x
upon  
x

x
cliffs  
x

x
of  
x

x
sand. 
x

x
Their  
x

x
friends  
x

x
could  
x

x
  
x

x
not  
x

x
help  
x

x
them,  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
from  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
renewed  
x

x
with  
x

x
redoubled  
x

x
force,  
x

x
and  
x

x
upon  
x

x
  
x

x
either  
x

x
side  
x

x
men  
x

x
and  
x

x
elves  
x

x
were  
x

x
being  
x

x
slowly  
x

x
  
x

x
beaten  
x

x
down. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
On  
x

x
all  
x

x
this  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
looked  
x

x
with  
x

x
misery. 
x

x
He  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
taken  
x

x
his  
x

x
stand  
x

x
on  
x

x
Ravenhill  
x

x
among  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
—  
x

x
  
x

x
partly  
x

x
because  
x

x
there  
x

x
was  
x

x
more  
x

x
chance  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
from  
x

x
that  
x

x
point,  
x

x
and  
x

x
partly  
x

x
(with  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
more  
x

x
Tookish  
x

x
part  
x

x
of  
x

x
his  
x

x
mind)  
x

x
because  
x

x
if  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
whole  
x

x
to  
x

x
defend  
x

x
the  
x

x
Elvenking. 
x

x
  
x

x
Gandalf,  
x

x
too,  
x

x
I  
x

x
may  
x

x
say,  
x

x
was  
x

x
there,  
x

x
sitting  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
as  
x

x
if  
x

x
in  
x

x
deep  
x

x
thought,  
x

x

x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
some  
x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
magic  
x

x
before  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
end. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
That  
x

x
did  
x

x
not  
x

x

x

x

x

x
off. 
x

x
“It  
x

x
will  
x

x
not  
x

x
be  
x

x
long  
x

x
  
x

x
now,”  
x

x
thought  
x

x
Bilbo,  
x

x
“before  
x

x
the  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
win  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Gate,  
x

x
and  
x

x
we  
x

x
are  
x

x
all  
x

x
slaughtered  
x

x

x

x
driven  
x

x
down  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
captured. 
x

x
Really  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
enough  
x

x
to  
x

x
make  
x

x
one  
x

x
  
x

x
weep,  
x

x
after  
x

x
all  
x

x
one  
x

x
has  
x

x
gone  
x

x
through. 
x

x
I  
x

x
would  
x

x
  
x

x
rather  
x

x
old  
x

x
Smaug  
x

x
had  
x

x
been  
x

x
left  
x

x
with  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wretched  
x

x
treasure,  
x

x
than  
x

x
that  
x

x
these  
x

x
vile  
x

x
creatures  
x

x
  
x

x
should  
x

x
get  
x

x
it,  
x

x
and  
x

x
poor  
x

x
old  
x

x
Bombur,  
x

x
and  
x

x
Balin  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
Fili  
x

x
and  
x

x
Kili  
x

x
and  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
rest  
x

x
come  
x

x
to  
x

x
a  
x

x
bad  
x

x
  
x

x
end;  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
too,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
Lake-men  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
merry  
x

x
elves. 
x

x
Misery  
x

x
me!  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
heard  
x

x
songs  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
many  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
I  
x

x

x

x
always  
x

x

x

x
that  
x

x

x
may  
x

x
be  
x

x

x

x
It  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
not  
x

x
to  
x

x

x

x

x

x
I  
x

x
wish  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
well  
x

x
out  
x

x
of  
x

x
it.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x

x

x
were  
x

x
torn  
x

x
by  
x

x
the  
x

x
wind,  
x

x
and  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
slashed  
x

x
the  
x

x
West. 
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
gloom  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
looked  
x

x
round. 
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
gave  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
had  
x

x
seen  
x

x

x

x

x

x
that  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
leap,  
x

x
dark  
x

x
shapes  
x

x
small  
x

x
yet  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
against  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“The  
x

x
Eagles!  
x

x
The  
x

x
Eagles!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
shouted. 
x

x
“The  
x

x
  
x

x
Eagles  
x

x
are  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
were  
x

x
seldom  
x

x
wrong. 
x

x
The  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
were  
x

x
coming  
x

x
down  
x

x
the  
x

x
wind,  
x

x
line  
x

x
after  
x

x
  
x

x
line,  
x

x
in  
x

x
such  
x

x
a  
x

x
host  
x

x
as  
x

x
must  
x

x
have  
x

x
gathered  
x

x
from  
x

x
  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
eyries  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
North. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“The  
x

x
Eagles!  
x

x
the  
x

x
Eagles!”  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
cried,  
x

x
  
x

x
dancing  
x

x
and  
x

x
waving  
x

x
his  
x

x
arms. 
x

x
If  
x

x
the  
x

x
elves  
x

x
could  
x

x
  
x

x
not  
x

x
see  
x

x
him  
x

x
they  
x

x
could  
x

x
hear  
x

x
him. 
x

x
Soon  
x

x
they  
x

x
too  
x

x
  
x

x
took  
x

x
up  
x

x
the  
x

x
cry,  
x

x
and  
x

x
it  
x

x
echoed  
x

x
across  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley. 
x

x
  
x

x
Many  
x

x
wondering  
x

x
eyes  
x

x
looked  
x

x
up,  
x

x
though  
x

x
as  
x

x
yet  
x

x
  
x

x
nothing  
x

x
could  
x

x
be  
x

x
seen  
x

x
except  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
southern  
x

x
  
x

x
shoulders  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“The  
x

x
Eagles!”  
x

x
cried  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
once  
x

x
more,  
x

x
but  
x

x
at  
x

x
  
x

x
that  
x

x
moment  
x

x
a  
x

x
stone  
x

x
hurtling  
x

x
from  
x

x
above  
x

x
smote  
x

x
  
x

x
heavily  
x

x
on  
x

x
his  
x

x
helm,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
fell  
x

x
with  
x

x
a  
x

x
crash  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
knew  
x

x
no  
x

x
more. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x
Chapter  
x

x
XVIII  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
THE  
x

x
RETURN  
x

x
JOURNEY  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
When  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
came  
x

x
to  
x

x
himself,  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
literally  
x

x
by  
x

x
  
x

x
himself. 
x

x
He  
x

x
was  
x

x
lying  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
flat  
x

x
stones  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
Ravenhill,  
x

x
and  
x

x
no  
x

x
one  
x

x
was  
x

x
near. 
x

x
A  
x

x
cloudless  
x

x
  
x

x
day,  
x

x
but  
x

x
cold,  
x

x
was  
x

x
broad  
x

x
above  
x

x
him. 
x

x
He  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
shaking,  
x

x
and  
x

x
as  
x

x
chilled  
x

x
as  
x

x
stone,  
x

x
but  
x

x
his  
x

x
head  
x

x
  
x

x
burned  
x

x
with  
x

x
fire. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
"Now  
x

x
I  
x

x
wonder  
x

x
what  
x

x
has  
x

x
happened?”  
x

x
he  
x

x
  
x

x
said  
x

x
to  
x

x
himself. 
x

x
“At  
x

x
any  
x

x
rate  
x

x
I  
x

x
am  
x

x
not  
x

x
yet  
x

x
one  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
fallen  
x

x
heroes;  
x

x
but  
x

x
I  
x

x
suppose  
x

x
there  
x

x
is  
x

x
still  
x

x
time  
x

x
  
x

x
enough  
x

x
for  
x

x
that!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
He  
x

x
sat  
x

x
up  
x

x
painfully. 
x

x
Looking  
x

x
into  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley  
x

x
  
x

x
he  
x

x
could  
x

x
see  
x

x
no  
x

x
living  
x

x
goblins. 
x

x
After  
x

x
a  
x

x
while  
x

x
as  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
head  
x

x
cleared  
x

x
a  
x

x
little,  
x

x
he  
x

x
thought  
x

x
he  
x

x
could  
x

x
  
x

x
see  
x

x
elves  
x

x
moving  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
rocks  
x

x
below. 
x

x
He  
x

x
  
x

x
rubbed  
x

x
his  
x

x
eyes. 
x

x
Surely  
x

x
there  
x

x
was  
x

x
a  
x

x
camp  
x

x
still  
x

x
  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
plain  
x

x
some  
x

x
distance  
x

x
off;  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
was  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
coming  
x

x
and  
x

x
going  
x

x
about  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate?  
x

x
Dwarves  
x

x
  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
busy  
x

x
removing  
x

x
the  
x

x
wall. 
x

x
But  
x

x
all  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
deadly  
x

x
still. 
x

x
There  
x

x
was  
x

x
no  
x

x
call  
x

x
and  
x

x
no  
x

x
echo  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
of  
x

x
a  
x

x
song. 
x

x
Sorrow  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
to  
x

x
be  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
air. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Victory  
x

x
after  
x

x
all,  
x

x
I  
x

x
suppose!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said,  
x

x
feeling  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
aching  
x

x
head. 
x

x
“Well,  
x

x
it  
x

x
seems  
x

x
a  
x

x
very  
x

x
gloomy  
x

x
  
x

x
business.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Suddenly  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
aware  
x

x
of  
x

x
a  
x

x
man  
x

x
climbing  
x

x
  
x

x
up  
x

x
and  
x

x
coming  
x

x
towards  
x

x
him. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Hullo  
x

x
there!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
called  
x

x
with  
x

x
a  
x

x
shaky  
x

x
voice. 
x

x
  
x

x
“Hullo  
x

x
there!  
x

x
What  
x

x
news?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“What  
x

x
voice  
x

x
is  
x

x
it  
x

x
that  
x

x
speaks  
x

x
among  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
stones?”  
x

x
said  
x

x
the  
x

x
man  
x

x
halting  
x

x
and  
x

x
peering  
x

x
  
x

x
about  
x

x
him  
x

x
not  
x

x
far  
x

x
from  
x

x
where  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
sat. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
remembered  
x

x
his  
x

x
ring!  
x

x
“Well  
x

x
I’m  
x

x
  
x

x
blessed!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
he. 
x

x
“This  
x

x
invisibility  
x

x
has  
x

x
its  
x

x
  
x

x
drawbacks  
x

x
after  
x

x
all. 
x

x
Otherwise  
x

x
I  
x

x
suppose  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
have  
x

x

x

x
a  
x

x
warm  
x

x
and  
x

x
comfortable  
x

x
night  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“It’s  
x

x

x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
Baggins,  
x

x
companion  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
Thorin!”  
x

x

x

x
cried,  
x

x
hurriedly  
x

x
taking  
x

x
off  
x

x
the  
x

x
ring. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“It  
x

x
is  
x

x
well  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
found  
x

x
you!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
man  
x

x

x

x
forward. 
x

x
“You  
x

x
are  
x

x
needed  
x

x
and  
x

x
we  
x

x
  
x

x
have  
x

x

x

x

x

x
you  
x

x

x

x
You  
x

x
would  
x

x
have  
x

x
been  
x

x
  
x

x
numbered  
x

x
among  
x

x
the  
x

x
dead,  
x

x
who  
x

x
are  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
Gandalf  
x

x
the  
x

wizard  
x

x

x

x
not  
x

x
said  
x

x
that  
x

x
your  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
last  
x

x
heard  
x

x
in  
x

x
this  
x

x
place. 
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
been  
x

x
sent  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
look  
x

x
here  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
last  
x

x
time. 
x

x
Are  
x

x
you  
x

x
much  
x

x
hurt?”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“A  
x

x
nasty  
x

x
knock  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
head,  
x

x
I  
x

x
think,”  
x

x
said  
x

x

Bilbo. 
x

x
“But  
x

x

x

x

x

x
a  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x
All  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
same  
x

x
I  
x

x
feel  
x

x
sick  
x

x
and  
x

x
my  
x

x

x

x
are  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
“I  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

said  
x

the  
x

x
man,  
x

x
and  
x

x
picked  
x

x
him  
x

x
lightly  
x

x
up. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
man  
x

x
was  
x

x
swift  
x

x
and  
x

x
sure-footed. 
x

x
It  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
not  
x

x
long  
x

x

x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
was  
x

x
set  
x

x
down  
x

x
before  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
tent  
x

x
in  
x

x
Dale;  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
stood  
x

x
Gandalf,  
x

x
with  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
arm  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x
Even  
x

x
the  
x

x
wizard  
x

x
had  
x

x
not  
x

x

x

x

x
without  
x

x
a  
x

x
wound;  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
were  
x

x
few  
x

x
  
x

x
unharmed  
x

x
in  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
host. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
he  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
“Baggins!”  
x

x

x

x

x

x
“Well  
x

x
I  
x

x
never!  
x

x
Alive  
x

x
  
x

x
after  
x

x
all  
x

x
—  
x

x
I  
x

x
am  
x

x

x

x

x

x
began  
x

x
to  
x

x
wonder  
x

x
if  
x

x
even  
x

x
  
x

x
your  
x

x
luck  
x

x
would  
x

x
see  
x

x
you  
x

x
through!  
x

x
A  
x

x
terrible  
x

x
  
x

x
business,  
x

x
and  
x

x
it  
x

x
nearly  
x

x
was  
x

x

x

x
But  
x

x
  
x

x
other  
x

x
news  
x

x
can  
x

x
wait. 
x

x
Come!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said  
x

x
more  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
“You  
x

x
are  
x

x
called  
x

x
for;”  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

he  
x

x
took  
x

x
him  
x

x
within  
x

x
the  
x

x
tent. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Hail!  
x

x
Thorin,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said  
x

x
as  
x

x
he  
x

x
entered. 
x

x
“I  
x

x
have  
x

x
  
x

x
brought  
x

x
him.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
There  
x

x
indeed  
x

x
lay  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
Oakenshield,  
x

x
  
x

x
wounded  
x

x
with  
x

x
many  
x

x
wounds,  
x

x
and  
x

x
his  
x

x
rent  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
notched  
x

x
axe  
x

x
were  
x

x
cast  
x

x
upon  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
up  
x

x

x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
came  
x

x
beside  
x

x
him. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Farewell,  
x

x
good  
x

x
thief,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said. 
x

x
“I  
x

x
go  
x

x
now  
x

x
to  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
halls  
x

x
of  
x

x
waiting  
x

x
to  
x

x
sit  
x

x
beside  
x

x
my  
x

x
fathers,  
x

x
until  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
world  
x

x
is  
x

x
renewed. 
x

x
Since  
x

x
I  
x

x
leave  
x

x
now  
x

x
all  
x

x
gold  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
and  
x

x

x

x
where  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
of  
x

x
little  
x

x

x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
wish  
x

x
to  
x

x
part  
x

x
in  
x

x
friendship  
x

x
from  
x

x
you,  
x

x
and  
x

x
I  
x

x
would  
x

x
  
x

x
take  
x

x
back  
x

x
my  
x

x
words  
x

x
and  
x

x
deeds  
x

x
at  
x

x
the  
x

x
Gate.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
knelt  
x

x
on  
x

x
one  
x

x
knee  
x

x
filled  
x

x
with  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
“Farewell,  
x

x
King  
x

x
under  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“This  
x

x
is  
x

x
a  
x

x
bitter  
x

x
adventure,  
x

x
if  
x

x
it  
x

x
must  
x

x
end  
x

x
so;  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
not  
x

x
a  
x

x
mountain  
x

x
of  
x

x
gold  
x

x
can  
x

x
amend  
x

x
it. 
x

x
Yet  
x

x
I  
x

x
am  
x

x
  
x

x
glad  
x

x
that  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
shared  
x

x
in  
x

x
your  
x

x
perils  
x

x
—  
x

x
that  
x

x
has  
x

x
  
x

x
been  
x

x
more  
x

x
than  
x

x
any  
x

x
Baggins  
x

x
deserves.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“No!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Thorin. 
x

x
“There  
x

x
is  
x

x
more  
x

x
in  
x

x
you  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
good  
x

x
than  
x

x
you  
x

x
know,  
x

x
child  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
kindly  
x

x
West. 
x

x
  
x

x
Some  
x

x
courage  
x

x
and  
x

x
some  
x

x
wisdom,  
x

x
blended  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
measure. 
x

x
If  
x

x
more  
x

x
of  
x

x
us  
x

x
valued  
x

x
food  
x

x
and  
x

x
cheer  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
song  
x

x
above  
x

x
hoarded  
x

x
gold,  
x

x
it  
x

x
would  
x

x
be  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
world. 
x

x
But  
x

x
sad  
x

x
or  
x

x
merry,  
x

x
I  
x

x
must  
x

x
leave  
x

x
it  
x

x
  
x

x
now. 
x

x
Farewell!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
turned  
x

x
away,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
went  
x

x
by  
x

x
  
x

x
himself,  
x

x
and  
x

x
sat  
x

x
alone  
x

x
wrapped  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x
blanket,  
x

x
  
x

x
and,  
x

x
whether  
x

x
you  
x

x
believe  
x

x
it  
x

x
or  
x

x
not,  
x

x
he  
x

x
wept  
x

x
until  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
eyes  
x

x
were  
x

x
red  
x

x
and  
x

x
his  
x

x
voice  
x

x
was  
x

x
hoarse. 
x

x
  
x

x
He  
x

x
was  
x

x
a  
x

x
kindly  
x

x
little  
x

x
soul. 
x

x
Indeed  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x
long  
x

x
  
x

x
before  
x

x
he  
x

x
had  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
to  
x

x
make  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x
again. 
x

x
  
x

x
“A  
x

x
mercy  
x

x
it  
x

x
is,”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said

x
at  
x

x
last  
x

x
to  
x

x
himself,  
x

x
“that  
x

x
I  
x

x
  
x

x
woke  
x

x
up  
x

x
when  
x

x
I  
x

x
did. 
x

x
I  
x

x
wish  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
were  
x

x
living,  
x

x
  
x

x
but  
x

x
I  
x

x
am  
x

x
glad  
x

x
that  
x

x
we  
x

x
parted  
x

x
in  
x

x
kindness. 
x

x
You  
x

x
  
x

x
are  
x

x
a  
x

x
fool,  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
Baggins,  
x

x
and  
x

x
you  
x

x
made  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
great  
x

x
mess  
x

x
of  
x

x
that  
x

x
business  
x

x
with  
x

x
the  
x

x
stone;  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
there  
x

x
was  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
all

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
son  
x

x
of  
x

x
Nain  
x

x
  
x

x
took  
x

x
up  
x

x
his  
x

x
abode,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
became  
x

x
King  
x

x
under  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain,  
x

x
and  
x

x
in  
x

x
time  
x

x
many  
x

x
other  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
  
x

x
gathered  
x

x
to  
x

x
his  
x

x
throne  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
ancient  
x

x
halls. 
x

x
Of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
twelve  
x

x
companions  
x

x
of  
x

x
Thorin,  
x

x
ten  
x

x
remained. 
x

x
  
x

x
Fili  
x

x
and  
x

x
Kili  
x

x
had  
x

x
fallen  
x

x
defending  
x

x
him  
x

x
with  
x

x
shield  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
body,  
x

x
for  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
their  
x

x
mother’s  
x

x
elder  
x

x
  
x

x
brother. 
x

x
The  
x

x
others  
x

x
remained  
x

x
with  
x

x
Dain;  
x

x
for  
x

x
  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
dealt  
x

x
his  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
well. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
There  
x

x
was,  
x

x
of  
x

x
course,  
x

x
no  
x

x
longer  
x

x
any  
x

x
  
x

x
question  
x

x
of  
x

x
dividing  
x

x
the  
x

x
hoard  
x

x
in  
x

x
such  
x

x
shares  
x

x
as  
x

x
  
x

x
had  
x

x
been  
x

x
planned,  
x

x
to  
x

x
Balin  
x

x
and  
x

x
Dwalin,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
Dori  
x

x
and  
x

x
Nori  
x

x
and  
x

x
Ori,  
x

x
and  
x

x
Oin  
x

x
and  
x

x
Gloin,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
Bifur  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bofur  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bombur  
x

x
—  
x

x
or  
x

x
to  
x

x
Bilbo. 
x

x
Yet  
x

x
a  
x

x
  
x

x
fourteenth  
x

x
share  
x

x
of  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
silver  
x

x
and  
x

x
gold,  
x

x
  
x

x
wrought  
x

x
and  
x

x
unwrought,  
x

x
was  
x

x
given  
x

x
up  
x

x
to  
x

x
Bard;  
x

x
  
x

x
for  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
said:  
x

x
“We  
x

x
will  
x

x
honour  
x

x
the  
x

x
agreement  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
dead,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
has  
x

x
now  
x

x
the  
x

x
Arkenstone  
x

x
in  
x

x
his  
x

x
  
x

x
keeping.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Even  
x

x
a  
x

x
fourteenth  
x

x
share  
x

x
was  
x

x
wealth  
x

x
  
x

x
exceedingly  
x

x
great,  
x

x
greater  
x

x
than  
x

x
that  
x

x
of  
x

x
many  
x

x
  
x

x
mortal  
x

x
kings. 
x

x
From  
x

x
that  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
Bard  
x

x
sent  
x

x
  
x

x
much  
x

x
gold  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
Master  
x

x
of  
x

x
Lake-town;  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
  
x

x
rewarded  
x

x
his  
x

x
followers  
x

x
and  
x

x
friends  
x

x
freely. 
x

x
To  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Elvenking  
x

x
he  
x

x
gave  
x

x
the  
x

x
emeralds  
x

x
of  
x

x
Girion,  
x

x
such  
x

x
  
x

x
jewels  
x

x
as  
x

x
he  
x

x
most  
x

x
loved,  
x

x
which  
x

x
Dain  
x

x
had  
x

x
  
x

x
restored  
x

x
to  
x

x
him. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
To  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
he  
x

x
said:  
x

x
“This  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
is  
x

x
as  
x

x
much  
x

x
  
x

x
yours  
x

x
as  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
mine;  
x

x
though  
x

x
old  
x

x
agreements  
x

x
  
x

x
cannot  
x

x
stand,  
x

x
since  
x

x
so  
x

x
many  
x

x
have  
x

x
a  
x

x
claim  
x

x
in  
x

x
its  
x

x
  
x

x
winning  
x

x
and  
x

x
defence. 
x

x
Yet  
x

x
even  
x

x
though  
x

x
you  
x

x
were  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
willing  
x

x
to  
x

x
lay  
x

x
aside  
x

x
all  
x

x
your  
x

x
claim,  
x

x
I  
x

x
should  
x

x
wish  
x

x
  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
words  
x

x
of  
x

x
Thorin,  
x

x
of  
x

x
which  
x

x
he  
x

x
repented,  
x

x
  
x

x
should  
x

x
not  
x

x
prove  
x

x
true:  
x

x
that  
x

x
we  
x

x
should  
x

x
give  
x

x
you  
x

x
  
x

x
little. 
x

x
I  
x

x
would  
x

x
reward  
x

x
you  
x

x
most  
x

x
richly  
x

x
of  
x

x
all.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Very  
x

x
kind  
x

x
of  
x

x
you,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Bilbo. 
x

x
“But  
x

x
really  
x

x
it  
x

x
  
x

x
is  
x

x
a  
x

x
relief  
x

x
to  
x

x
me. 
x

x
How  
x

x
on  
x

x
earth  
x

x
should  
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
got  
x

x
  
x

x
all  
x

x
that  
x

x
treasure  
x

x
home  
x

x
without  
x

x
war  
x

x
and  
x

x
murder  
x

x
  
x

x
all  
x

x
along  
x

x
the  
x

x
way,  
x

x
I  
x

x
don’t  
x

x
know. 
x

x
And  
x

x
I  
x

x
don’t  
x

x
know  
x

x
  
x

x
what  
x

x
I  
x

x
should  
x

x
have  
x

x
done  
x

x
with  
x

x
it  
x

x
when  
x

x
I  
x

x
got  
x

x
home. 
x

x
  
x

x
I  
x

x
am  
x

x
sure  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
better  
x

x
in  
x

x
your  
x

x
hands.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
In  
x

x
the  
x

x
end  
x

x
he  
x

x
would  
x

x
only  
x

x
take  
x

x
two  
x

x
small  
x

x
  
x

x
chests,  
x

x
one  
x

x
filled  
x

x
with  
x

x
silver,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
other  
x

x
with  
x

x
  
x

x
gold,  
x

x
such  
x

x
as  
x

x
one  
x

x
strong  
x

x
pony  
x

x
could  
x

x
carry. 
x

x
“That  
x

x
  
x

x
will  
x

x
be  
x

x
quite  
x

x
as  
x

x
much  
x

x
as  
x

x
I  
x

x
can  
x

x
manage,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
  
x

x
he. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
At  
x

x
last  
x

x
the  
x

x
time  
x

x
came  
x

x
for  
x

x
him  
x

x
to  
x

x
say  
x

x
good-  
x

x
  
x

x
bye  
x

x
to  
x

x
his  
x

x
friends. 
x

x
“Farewell,  
x

x
Balin!”  
x

x
he  
x

x
said;  
x

x
  
x

x
“and  
x

x
farewell,  
x

x
Dwalin;  
x

x
and  
x

x
farewell  
x

x
Dori,  
x

x
Nori,  
x

x
  
x

x
Ori,  
x

x
Oin,  
x

x
Gloin,  
x

x
Bifur,  
x

x
Bofur,  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bombur!  
x

x
May  
x

x
  
x

x
your  
x

x
beards  
x

x
never  
x

x
grow  
x

x
thin!”  
x

x
And  
x

x
turning  
x

x
  
x

x
towards  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain  
x

x
he  
x

x
added:  
x

x
“Farewell  
x

x
  
x

x
Thorin  
x

x
Oakenshield!  
x

x
And  
x

x
Fili  
x

x
and  
x

x
Kili!  
x

x
May  
x

x
your  
x

x
  
x

x
memory  
x

x
never  
x

x
fade!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
the  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
bowed  
x

x
low  
x

x
before  
x

x
their  
x

x
  
x

x
Gate,  
x

x
but  
x

x
words  
x

x
stuck  
x

x
in  
x

x
their  
x

x
throats. 
x

x
“Good-  
x

x
  
x

x
bye  
x

x
and  
x

x
good  
x

x
luck,  
x

x
wherever  
x

x
you  
x

x
fare!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
  
x

x
Balin  
x

x
at  
x

x
last. 
x

x
“If  
x

x
ever  
x

x
you  
x

x
visit  
x

x
us  
x

x
again,  
x

x
when  
x

x
our  
x

x
  
x

x
halls  
x

x
are  
x

x
made  
x

x
fair  
x

x
once  
x

x
more,  
x

x
then  
x

x
the  
x

x
feast  
x

x
  
x

x
shall  
x

x
indeed  
x

x
be  
x

x
splendid!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“If  
x

x
ever  
x

x
you  
x

x
are  
x

x
passing  
x

x
my  
x

x
way,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
  
x

x
Bilbo,  
x

x
“don’t  
x

x
wait  
x

x
to  
x

x
knock!  
x

x
Tea  
x

x
is  
x

x
at  
x

x
four;  
x

x
but  
x

x
  
x

x
any  
x

x
of  
x

x
you  
x

x
are  
x

x
welcome  
x

x
at  
x

x
anytime!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Then  
x

x
he  
x

x
turned  
x

x
away. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
The  
x

x
elf-host  
x

x
was  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
march;  
x

x
and  
x

x
if  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
sadly  
x

x
lessened,  
x

x
yet  
x

x
many  
x

x
were  
x

x
glad,  
x

x
for  
x

x
now  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
northern  
x

x
world  
x

x
would  
x

x
be  
x

x
merrier  
x

x
for  
x

x
many  
x

x
a  
x

x
long  
x

x
  
x

x
day. 
x

x
The  
x

x
dragon  
x

x
was  
x

x
dead,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
  
x

x
overthrown,  
x

x
and  
x

x
their  
x

x
hearts  
x

x
looked  
x

x
forward  
x

x
  
x

x
after  
x

x
winter  
x

x
to  
x

x
a  
x

x
spring  
x

x
of  
x

x
joy. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
Gandalf  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
rode  
x

x
behind  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Elvenking,  
x

x
and  
x

x
beside  
x

x
them  
x

x
strode  
x

x
Beorn,  
x

x
once  
x

x
  
x

x
again  
x

x
in  
x

x
man’s  
x

x
shape,  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
laughed  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
sang  
x

x
in  
x

x
a  
x

x
loud  
x

x
voice  
x

x
upon  
x

x
the  
x

x
road. 
x

x
So  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
went  
x

x
on  
x

x
until  
x

x
they  
x

x
drew  
x

x
near  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
borders  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
Mirkwood,  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
north  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
place  
x

x
where  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Forest  
x

x
River  
x

x
ran  
x

x
out. 
x

x
Then  
x

x
they  
x

x
halted,  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
wizard  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
would  
x

x
not  
x

x
enter  
x

x
the  
x

x
wood,  
x

x
  
x

x
even  
x

x
though  
x

x
the  
x

x
king  
x

x
bade  
x

x
them  
x

x
stay  
x

x
a  
x

x
while  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
his  
x

x
halls. 
x

x
They  
x

x
intended  
x

x
to  
x

x
go  
x

x
along  
x

x
the  
x

x
edge  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
forest,  
x

x
and  
x

x
round  
x

x
its  
x

x
northern  
x

x
end  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
waste  
x

x
that  
x

x
lay  
x

x
between  
x

x
it  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
beginning  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
Grey  
x

x
Mountains. 
x

x
It  
x

x
was  
x

x
a  
x

x
long  
x

x
and  
x

x
cheerless  
x

x
  
x

x
road,  
x

x
but  
x

x
now  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
were  
x

x
crushed,  
x

x
it  
x

x
  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
safer  
x

x
to  
x

x
them  
x

x
than  
x

x
the  
x

x
dreadful  
x

x
  
x

x
pathways  
x

x
under  
x

x
the  
x

x
trees. 
x

x
Moreover  
x

x
Beorn  
x

x
was  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
going  
x

x
that  
x

x
way  
x

x
too. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Farewell!  
x

x
O  
x

x
Elvenking!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Gandalf. 
x

x
  
x

x
“Merry  
x

x
be  
x

x
the  
x

x
greenwood,  
x

x
while  
x

x
the  
x

x
world  
x

x
is  
x

x
yet  
x

x
  
x

x
young!  
x

x
And  
x

x
merry  
x

x
be  
x

x
all  
x

x
your  
x

x
folk!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Farewell!  
x

x
O  
x

x
Gandalf!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
the  
x

x
king. 
x

x
“May  
x

x
  
x

x
you  
x

x
ever  
x

x
appear  
x

x
where  
x

x
you  
x

x
are  
x

x
most  
x

x
needed  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
least  
x

x
expected!  
x

x
The  
x

x
oftener  
x

x
you  
x

x
appear  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
my  
x

x
halls  
x

x
the  
x

x
better  
x

x
shall  
x

x
I  
x

x
be  
x

x
pleased!”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“I  
x

x
beg  
x

x
of  
x

x
you,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
stammering  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
standing  
x

x
on  
x

x
one  
x

x
foot,  
x

x
“to  
x

x
accept  
x

x
this  
x

x
gift!”  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
out  
x

a  
x

x

x

x
of  
x

x

x

and  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
had  
x

x
given  
x

x
him  
x

x
at  
x

x
their  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

“In  
x

x

x

x

x
have  
x

x

x
earned  
x

x
such  
x

x
a  
x

x
gift,  
x

x
O  
x

x
  
x

x
hobbit?”  
x

x
said  
x

x
the  
x

x
king. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“Well,  
x

x
er,  
x

x
I  
x

x
thought,  
x

x
don’t  
x

x
you  
x

x
know,”  
x

x
said  
x

x
  
x

Bilbo  
x

x
rather  
x

x
confused,  
x

x
“that,  
x

x
er,  
x

x
some  
x

x
little  
x

x
return  
x

x
  
x

x
should  
x

x
be  
x

x
made  
x

x
for  
x

x
your,  
x

x
er,  
x

x
hospitality. 
x

x
I  
x

x
mean  
x

x
  
x

x
even  
x

x
a  
x

x
burglar  
x

x
has  
x

x
his  
x

x
feelings. 
x

x
I  
x

x
have  
x

x
drunk  
x

x
  
x

x
much  
x

x
of  
x

x
your  
x

x
wine  
x

x
and  
x

x
eaten  
x

x
much  
x

x
of  
x

x
your  
x

x
  
x

x
bread.”  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“I  
x

x
will  
x

x
take  
x

x
your  
x

x
gift,  
x

x
O  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Magnificent!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
the

x

x

“And  
x

x
I  
x

x
name  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
less  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
too  
x

x

x
  
x

x
Farewell!”

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
his  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
got  
x

x
back. 
x

x
The  
x

x
Wild  
x

x
was  
x

x
still  
x

x
the  
x

x
Wild,  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
there  
x

x
were  
x

x
many  
x

x
other  
x

x
things  
x

x
in  
x

x
it  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
goblins;  
x

x
but  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
well  
x

x

x

x

x
well  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x
wizard  
x

x
was  
x

x
with  
x

x
him,  
x

x
and  
x

x
Beorn  
x

x
  
x

x
for  
x

x
much  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
way  
x

x
—  
x

x
and  
x

x
he  
x

x
was  
x

x
never  
x

x
in  
x

x
great  
x

x
  
x

x
danger  
x

x

x

x
Anyway  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
had  
x

x
come  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
way  
x

x
back,  
x

x
along  
x

both  
x

x
edges  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Forest,  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
house;  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
for  
x

x
a  
x

x

x
they  
x

x
both  
x

x
  
x

x
stayed. 
x

x
Yule-tide  
x

x
was  
x

x
warm  
x

x
and  
x

x
merry  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
from  
x

x
far  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x

at  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
bidding. 
x

x
The  
x

x
goblins  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Misty  
x

x
  
x

x
Mountains  
x

x
were  
x

x
now  
x

x
few  
x

x
and  
x

x
terrified,  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
holes  
x

x

x

x
could  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
had  
x

x
vanished  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
woods,  
x

x
so  
x

x
  
x

x
that  
x

x
men  
x

x
went  
x

x
abroad  
x

x
without  
x

x
fear. 
x

x
Beorn  
x

x
  
x

x
indeed  
x

x
became  
x

x
a  
x

x
great  
x

x
chief  
x

x
afterwards  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
those  
x

x
regions  
x

x

x

x

x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
wood;  
x

x
and  
x

x
it  
x

x
is  
x

x
said  
x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x
for  
x

x
many  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
of  
x

x
his  
x

x
line  
x

x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x

x
of  
x

x
taking  
x

x
bear’s  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
last

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
Wild. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
up  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
pass  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
them  
x

x
before. 
x

x
But  
x

x
they  
x

x
came  
x

x
to  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
point  
x

x
at  
x

x
morning,  
x

x
and  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x
shining  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
lands. 
x

x
There  
x

x
behind  
x

x
lay  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
blue  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
distance,  
x

x
and  
x

x
darkly  
x

x
green  
x

x
at  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
nearer  
x

x
edge  
x

x
even  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
spring. 
x

x
There  
x

x
far  
x

x
away  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
the  
x

x
Lonely  
x

x
Mountain  
x

x
on  
x

x
the  
x

x
edge  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
eyesight. 
x

x
On  
x

x
its  
x

x
highest  
x

x
peak  
x

x
snow  
x

x
yet  
x

x
  
x

x
unmelted  
x

x
was  
x

x
gleaming  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
“So  
x

x
comes  
x

x
snow  
x

x

x

x
fire,  
x

x
and  
x

x
even  
x

x
  
x

x
dragons  
x

x

x

x
their  
x

x

x

x
said  
x

x
Bilbo,  
x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
turned  
x

x
his  
x

x
back  
x

x
on  
x

x
his  
x

x
adventure. 
x

x
The  
x

x
Tookish  
x

x
  
x

x
part  
x

x
was  
x

x
getting  
x

x
very  
x

x
tired,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
Baggins  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
daily  
x

x

x

x

x

x
“I  
x

x
wish  
x

x
now  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
THE  
x

x
LAST  
x

x
STAGE  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
It  
x

x
was  
x

x
on  
x

x
May  
x

x
the  
x

x
First  
x

x
that  
x

x
the  
x

x
two  
x

x
came  
x

x
back  
x

x
  
x

x
at  
x

x
last  
x

x
to  
x

x
the  
x

x
brink  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
valley  
x

x
of  
x

x
Rivendell,  
x

x
  
x

x
where  
x

x
stood  
x

x
the  
x

x
Last  
x

x
(or  
x

x
the  
x

x
First)  
x

x
Homely  
x

x
  
x

x
House. 
x

x
Again  
x

x
it  
x

x
was  
x

x
evening,  
x

x
their  
x

x
ponies  
x

x
were  
x

x
  
x

x
tired,  
x

x
especially  
x

x
the  
x

x
one  
x

x
that  
x

x
carried  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
baggage;  
x

x
and  
x

x
they  
x

x
all  
x

x
felt  
x

x
in  
x

x
need  
x

x
of  
x

x
rest. 
x

x
As  
x

x
  
x

x
they  
x

x
rode  
x

x
down  
x

x
the  
x

x
steep  
x

x
path,  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
heard  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
elves  
x

x
still  
x

x
singing  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
trees,  
x

x
as  
x

x
if  
x

x
they  
x

x
had  
x

x
not  
x

x
  
x

x
stopped  
x

x
since  
x

x
he  
x

x
left;  
x

x
and  
x

x
as  
x

x
soon  
x

x
as  
x

x
the  
x

x
riders  
x

x
  
x

x
came  
x

x
down  
x

x
into  
x

x
the  
x

x
lower  
x

x
glades  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
wood  
x

x
  
x

x
they  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x
laughter. 
x

x
“It  
x

x
is  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

now

x

x

x

x

said. 
x

“Something  
x

x

x

x

great

x
  
x

x
magnificence. 
x

x
  
x

x
  
x

x
They  
x

x
fell  
x

x
to  
x

x
talking  
x

x
of  
x

x
their  
x

x
times  
x

x
together,  
x

x
of  
x

x
  
x

x
course,  
x

x
and  
x

x
Bilbo  
x

x
asked  
x

x
how  
x

x
things  
x

x
were  
x

x
going  
x

x
  
x

x
in  
x

x
the  
x

x
lands  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
Mountain. 
x

x
It  
x

x
seemed  
x

x
they  
x

x
  
x

x
were  
x

x
going  
x

x
very  
x

x
well. 
x

x
Bard  
x

x
had  
x

x
rebuilt  
x

x
the  
x

x
town  
x

x
  
x

x
in  
x

x
Dale  
x

x
and  
x

x
men  
x

x
had  
x

x
gathered  
x

x
to  
x

x
him  
x

x
from  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
Lake  
x

x
and  
x

x
from  
x

x
South  
x

x
and  
x

x
West,  
x

x
and  
x

x
all  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
valley  
x

x
had  
x

x
become  
x

x
tilled  
x

x
again  
x

x
and  
x

x
rich,  
x

x
and  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

x
desolation  
x

x
was  
x

x
now  
x

x
filled  
x

x
with  
x

x
birds  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
blossoms  
x

x
in  
x

x
spring  
x

x
and  
x

x
fruit  
x

x
and  
x

x
feasting  
x

x
in  
x

x
  
x

x
autumn. 
x

x
And  
x

x
Lake-town  
x

x
was  
x

x
refounded  
x

x
and  
x

x
  
x

x
was  
x

x
more  
x

x
prosperous  
x

x
than  
x

x
ever,  
x

x
and  
x

x
much  
x

x
  
x

x
wealth  
x

x
went  
x

x
up  
x

x
and  
x

x
down  
x

x
the  
x

x
Running  
x

x
River;  
x

x
  
x

x
and  
x

x
there  
x

x
was  
x

x
friendship  
x

x
in  
x

x
those  
x

x
parts  
x

x
  
x

x
between  
x

x
elves  
x

x
and  
x

x
dwarves  
x

x
and  
x

x
men.

x

x
Hall

Bag-End  
x

x

x

of  
x

x
B. 
x

x
  
x

x
Baggins

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
had  
x

x

x

x
to  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x

much  
x

x
gold  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x

of  
x

x
  
x

x
the  
x

x
Lake-people,  
x

x
but  
x

x
being  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x
kind  
x

x
that  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x

x

x
such  
x

x
disease  
x

x

x

x
fell  
x

x
under  
x

x
the  
x

x
  
x

dragon-sickness,  
x

x
and  
x

x
took  
x

most  
x

x
of  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x
with  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
new  
x

x

x

x
is  
x

of  
x

x
wiser  
x

x

x

x

x

“and  
x

x

x

x

x

x
for,  
x

x

x

x

x

x
he  
x

x
gets  
x

x
  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

credit  
x

x
for  
x

x
the  
x

x

x

x
  
x

x

x
are  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
that  
x

in  
x

x

x
  
x

x

x

x
the  
x

x
rivers  
x

x
run  
x

x
with  
x

x
gold.”

“Then  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
the  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x

x
after  
x

x
a  
x

x

x

x

x

x

x
“Of  
x

x
course!”  
x

x
said  
x

x
Gandalf. 
x

“And  
x

x

x
